div.h2: SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM mappings for fracture of ulna (http://hl7.org/fhir/ConceptMap/103)
div.p: DRAFT (not intended for production usage). Published on 2012-06-13 by HL7, Inc (FHIR project team (example): http://hl7.org/fhir). Creative Commons 0
Example rule-based mappings between SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM for fracture of ulna
Group 1Mapping from SNOMEDÂ CT International Edition to International Classification of Diseases, 10th Revision, Clinical Modification (ICD-10-CM)

tr.td: S52.209A (Unsp fracture of shaft of unsp ulna, init for clos fx)

The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is 'source-is-broader-than-target', since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent) and fracture type is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.
S52.209D (Unsp fx shaft of unsp ulna, subs for clos fx w routn heal)

The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is 'source-is-broader-than-target', since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent), fracture type and healing (for subsequent encounter) is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.
